clusters.title: Trump says $500m deal reached with Harvard to settle dispute
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Says Deal Reached with Harvard, Details Pending

items.title: Trump says $500m deal reached with Harvard to settle dispute
items.standfirst: US president says ‘Linda is finishing up the details’ but not clear whether university ready to announce agreementUS politics – latest updatesDonald Trump said on Tuesday that his administration had reached a deal with Harvard and that the school would pay $500m to settle the dispute between the federal government and the university.“Linda is finishing up the final details,” Trump told reporters at an event in the Oval Office, referring to Linda McMahon, the education secretary. “And they’ll be paying about $500m and they’ll be operating trade schools. They’re going to be teaching people how to do AI and lots of other things, engines, lots of things.” Continue reading...
items.content: US president says ‘Linda is finishing up the details’ but not clear whether university ready to announce agreementUS politics – latest updatesDonald Trump said on Tuesday that his administration had reached a deal with Harvard and that the school would pay $500m to settle the dispute between the federal government and the university.“Linda is finishing up the final details,” Trump told reporters at an event in the Oval Office, referring to Linda McMahon, the education secretary. “And they’ll be paying about $500m and they’ll be operating trade schools. They’re going to be teaching people how to do AI and lots of other things, engines, lots of things.” Continue reading...

items.title: Trump gives Hamas ‘three or four days’ to respond to his peace plan for Gaza
items.standfirst: US president warns militant group will ‘pay in hell’ if it rejects the deal, which seeks to end two-year-long warDonald Trump has given Hamas an ultimatum of “three or four days” to respond to his proposed peace and reconstruction plan in Gaza, warning the militant group would “pay in hell” if it rejects the deal, as the Israeli offensive continued, inflicting further civilian casualties.Trump’s proposal was announced in a joint press conference in Washington with Israel’s prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, and seeks a definitive end to the relentless two-year-long war. At least 31 Palestinians were killed across Gaza on Tuesday, local hospitals said. Continue reading...

items.content: Spotify's Daniel Ek announces that he'll step aside as CEO Daniel Ek, who co-founded Spotify and has been the most visible face of the company as it has grown into the world's biggest music streaming service, has announced that he will step down as the streaming giant's chief executive in…

items.title: Spotify's Daniel Ek announces that he'll step aside as CEO
items.standfirst: The founder of the world's biggest music streaming service says he'll remain at the company as Executive Chairman, and will be replaced by two co-CEOs.
items.content: The founder of the world's biggest music streaming service says he'll remain at the company as Executive Chairman, and will be replaced by two co-CEOs.(Image credit: Presley Ann)

items.title: Spotify founder Daniel Ek steps down from CEO role
items.standfirst: Ek founded Stockholm-based music streaming company nearly two decades ago and will stay on as executive chairSpotify said Tuesday that founder Daniel Ek is stepping down as CEO to become the executive chair.The Stockholm-based streaming giant said Ek will be replaced by two lieutenants who will become co-CEOs: chief product and technology officer Gustav Söderström and chief business officer Alex Norström. The pair, who are also currently co-presidents, will transition into their new jobs on 1 January. Continue reading...
items.content: Ek founded Stockholm-based music streaming company nearly two decades ago and will stay on as executive chairSpotify said Tuesday that founder Daniel Ek is stepping down as CEO to become the executive chair.The Stockholm-based streaming giant said Ek will be replaced by two lieutenants who will become co-CEOs: chief product and technology officer Gustav Söderström and chief business officer Alex Norström. The pair, who are also currently co-presidents, will transition into their new jobs on 1 January. Continue reading...

items.title: Spotify Names Co-CEOs as Daniel Ek Transitions to Chairman
items.standfirst: Spotify Technology SA Chief Executive Officer Daniel Ek is stepping aside after almost two decades at the music streaming company he co-founded, leaving the leadership in the hands of two trusted executives.
items.content: Spotify Technology SA Chief Executive Officer Daniel Ek is stepping aside after almost two decades at the music streaming company he co-founded, leaving the leadership in the hands of two trusted executives.

ai_summary: Daniel Ek, Spotify's founder, is stepping down as CEO to become executive chair.
Ek co-founded Spotify nearly two decades ago and has been the face of the company.
Two co-CEOs, Gustav Söderström and Alex Norström, will replace Ek on January 1st.
Ek will remain at Spotify as Executive Chairman of the board.
Spotify's rise transformed the music business and paved the way for streaming.

clusters.title: Central Philippines hit by powerful 6.9-magnitude earthquake, killing at least 20 people
clusters.neutral_headline: Earthquake in Philippines Kills at Least 20

items.title: Central Philippines hit by powerful 6.9-magnitude earthquake, killing at least 20 people
items.standfirst: A 6.9-magnitude earthquake struck the central Philippines late Tuesday, killing people at a sports arena and raising fears of major damage, officials said. The quake hit around 10 p.m. local time at a shallow depth near Palompon, close to Bogo city in Cebu province, the US Geological Survey reported.
items.content: A 6.9-magnitude earthquake struck the central Philippines late Tuesday, killing people at a sports arena and raising fears of major damage, officials said. The quake hit around 10 p.m. local time at a shallow depth near Palompon, close to Bogo city in Cebu province, the US Geological Survey reported.

items.title: Strong earthquake in central Philippines kills at least 6 people and damages houses and buildings
items.standfirst: An offshore earthquake of magnitude 6.9 jolted the central Philippines and collapsed the walls of buildings late Tuesday, killing at least six people, injuring several more and sending residents scrambling out of homes into darkness as the intense shaking cut off power, officials said.
items.content: An offshore earthquake of magnitude 6.9 jolted the central Philippines and collapsed the walls of buildings late Tuesday, killing at least six people, injuring several more and sending residents scrambling out of homes into darkness as the intense shaking cut off power, officials said.

items.title: Central Philippines hit by powerful 6.9-magnitude earthquake
items.standfirst: Power knocked out and buildings and roads damaged as rescuers search for casualtiesA 6.9-magnitude quake has struck off the the central Philippines coast, damaging buildings and roads and knocking out power in parts of the region, as rescuers searched for casualties.Municipal workers checked a collapsed public building and a gym, both in the north of the island of Cebu, hours after the quake struck at sea off its northern tip at 9:59pm (1359 GMT), said Wilson Ramos, a provincial rescue official. Continue reading...
items.content: Power knocked out and buildings and roads damaged as rescuers search for casualtiesA 6.9-magnitude quake has struck off the the central Philippines coast, damaging buildings and roads and knocking out power in parts of the region, as rescuers searched for casualties.Municipal workers checked a collapsed public building and a gym, both in the north of the island of Cebu, hours after the quake struck at sea off its northern tip at 9:59pm (1359 GMT), said Wilson Ramos, a provincial rescue official. Continue reading...

items.title: At least five dead after powerful earthquake hits off Philippines coast
items.standfirst: Rescue efforts under way after quake off Cebu island sends people running into the streets, damages buildings.
items.content: Rescue efforts under way after quake off Cebu island sends people running into the streets, damages buildings.

ai_summary: A 6.9-magnitude earthquake struck the central Philippines late Tuesday.
The quake killed at least 20 people and caused damage to buildings and roads.
The earthquake hit near Palompon, close to Bogo city in Cebu province.
Power was knocked out in parts of the region after the earthquake.
Rescuers are searching for casualties after the earthquake.

items.title: Government faces midnight shutdown deadline as Senate votes
items.standfirst: The Senate plans to vote for a House-passed bill to keep the government open, but Democrats remain opposed ahead of a midnight deadline. Follow live updates here.
items.content: The Senate plans to vote for a House-passed bill to keep the government open, but Democrats remain opposed ahead of a midnight deadline. Follow live updates here.

items.title: US government nears first shutdown in nearly 7 years amid partisan standoff
items.standfirst: Democrats and Republicans traded blame Tuesday as a government shutdown loomed, with neither side willing to compromise on health care and spending. Hundreds of thousands of federal workers risked furloughs as lawmakers failed to reach a deal.
items.content: Democrats and Republicans traded blame Tuesday as a government shutdown loomed, with neither side willing to compromise on health care and spending. Hundreds of thousands of federal workers risked furloughs as lawmakers failed to reach a deal.

clusters.title: DR Congo ex-president Kabila sentenced to death in absentia for 'treason'
clusters.neutral_headline: Former DRC President Kabila Sentenced to Death

items.title: DR Congo ex-president Kabila sentenced to death in absentia for 'treason'
items.standfirst: A military court in the Democratic Republic of Congo on Tuesday sentenced ex-president Joseph Kabila to death in absentia for "treason". Kabila, 54, who was neither present nor represented at the trial in the capital, Kinshasa, was found guilty of complicity with the M23 anti-government armed group, which has seized swathes of the resource-rich Congolese east with Rwandan help. Emmett Livingstone reports from Kinshasa.
items.content: A military court in the Democratic Republic of Congo on Tuesday sentenced ex-president Joseph Kabila to death in absentia for "treason". Kabila, 54, who was neither present nor represented at the trial in the capital, Kinshasa, was found guilty of complicity with the M23 anti-government armed group, which has seized swathes of the resource-rich Congolese east with Rwandan help. Emmett Livingstone reports from Kinshasa.

items.title: Former DRC president Joseph Kabila sentenced to death in absentia
items.standfirst: Military court convicts Kabila of war crimes, treason and other offences in verdict that could fuel enduring tensionsA military court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has sentenced the country’s former president Joseph Kabila to death in absentia after convicting him of war crimes, treason and crimes against humanity.The case stems from his alleged role in backing the advance of M23 rebels supported by Rwanda in DRC’s volatile eastern provinces. Kabila, who led the country from 2001 to 2019, has denied wrongdoing and said the judiciary had been politicised. Continue reading...
items.content: Military court convicts Kabila of war crimes, treason and other offences in verdict that could fuel enduring tensionsA military court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has sentenced the country’s former president Joseph Kabila to death in absentia after convicting him of war crimes, treason and crimes against humanity.The case stems from his alleged role in backing the advance of M23 rebels supported by Rwanda in DRC’s volatile eastern provinces. Kabila, who led the country from 2001 to 2019, has denied wrongdoing and said the judiciary had been politicised. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: Joseph Kabila, the former president of the Democratic Republic of Congo, has been sentenced to death in absentia for treason and other charges by a military court in Kinshasa. Kabila, whose whereabouts are unknown, has denied the allegations.
items.content: Joseph Kabila, the former president of the Democratic Republic of Congo, has been sentenced to death in absentia for treason and other charges by a military court in Kinshasa. Kabila, whose whereabouts are unknown, has denied the allegations.

ai_summary: A military court sentenced ex-president Joseph Kabila to death in absentia.

items.standfirst: Deal with The Sims and Madden NFL maker is biggest leveraged buyout attempt, another key move for Silver LakeElectronic Arts, maker of video games such as Madden NFL, Battlefield, and The Sims, is being acquired for $55bn, the biggest leveraged buyout attempt in history.Under the terms of the deal announced on Monday, the private equity firm Silver Lake Partners, Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund PIF and Affinity Partners will pay EA’s stockholders $210 per share. Affinity Partners is a private equity firm run by Donald Trump’s son-in-law, Jared Kushner. Continue reading...
items.content: Deal with The Sims and Madden NFL maker is biggest leveraged buyout attempt, another key move for Silver LakeElectronic Arts, maker of video games such as Madden NFL, Battlefield, and The Sims, is being acquired for $55bn, the biggest leveraged buyout attempt in history.Under the terms of the deal announced on Monday, the private equity firm Silver Lake Partners, Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund PIF and Affinity Partners will pay EA’s stockholders $210 per share. Affinity Partners is a private equity firm run by Donald Trump’s son-in-law, Jared Kushner. Continue reading...

clusters.title: UN calls for Taliban to restore internet as Afghanistan goes dark
clusters.neutral_headline: Afghanistan hit by communications blackout after Taliban shuts internet

items.title: UN calls for Taliban to restore internet as Afghanistan goes dark
items.standfirst: The United Nations called on Afghanistan's Taliban authorities Tuesday to immediately restore internet and telecommunications in the country, 24 hours after a nationwide blackout was imposed. The government began shutting down high-speed internet connections to some provinces earlier this month to prevent "immorality", on the orders of shadowy supreme leader Hibatullah Akhundzada. FRANCE 24's Charlotte Lam reports.
items.content: The United Nations called on Afghanistan's Taliban authorities Tuesday to immediately restore internet and telecommunications in the country, 24 hours after a nationwide blackout was imposed. The government began shutting down high-speed internet connections to some provinces earlier this month to prevent "immorality", on the orders of shadowy supreme leader Hibatullah Akhundzada. FRANCE 24's Charlotte Lam reports.

items.title: Afghanistan ‘blind without phones and internet’ on second day of telecoms blackout
items.standfirst: Taliban authorities cut fibre-optic network in nationwide shutdown of communications to prevent ‘vice’Afghans are living under a near-complete communications blackout after Taliban authorities cut internet and mobile phone services for a second day as part of an unprecedented country-wide crackdown.The former insurgents, who retook control of Afghanistan in 2021, began gradual restrictions on internet access earlier this month. The measures also affect telephone lines, as they are often routed over the internet. Continue reading...
items.content: Taliban authorities cut fibre-optic network in nationwide shutdown of communications to prevent ‘vice’Afghans are living under a near-complete communications blackout after Taliban authorities cut internet and mobile phone services for a second day as part of an unprecedented country-wide crackdown.The former insurgents, who retook control of Afghanistan in 2021, began gradual restrictions on internet access earlier this month. The measures also affect telephone lines, as they are often routed over the internet. Continue reading...

items.title: Afghanistan hit by communications blackout after Taliban shuts internet
items.standfirst: Telecoms disrupted nationwide after authorities cut fibre-optic connections in several provinces to prevent ‘vice’A huge communications blackout has hit Afghanistan after Taliban authorities began severing fibre-optic connections in several provinces to prevent “vice”.“A nationwide telecoms blackout is now in effect,” said Netblocks, a watchdog organisation that monitors cybersecurity and internet governance. Continue reading...
items.content: Telecoms disrupted nationwide after authorities cut fibre-optic connections in several provinces to prevent ‘vice’A huge communications blackout has hit Afghanistan after Taliban authorities began severing fibre-optic connections in several provinces to prevent “vice”.“A nationwide telecoms blackout is now in effect,” said Netblocks, a watchdog organisation that monitors cybersecurity and internet governance. Continue reading...

The shutdown is nationwide, affecting all of Afghanistan.

The blackout has been in effect for two days.

items.standfirst: Zhimin Qian pleads guilty after wallets with 61,000 bitcoins, currently worth over £5bn, seized from north London homeA woman has been convicted for her role in a multibillion-pound bitcoin fraud after what is thought to have been the world’s largest cryptocurrency seizure.Zhimin Qian, also known as Yadi Zhang, 45, orchestrated a fraud in China between 2014 and 2017 that left 128,000 people out of pocket. Continue reading...
items.content: Zhimin Qian pleads guilty after wallets with 61,000 bitcoins, currently worth over £5bn, seized from north London homeA woman has been convicted for her role in a multibillion-pound bitcoin fraud after what is thought to have been the world’s largest cryptocurrency seizure.Zhimin Qian, also known as Yadi Zhang, 45, orchestrated a fraud in China between 2014 and 2017 that left 128,000 people out of pocket. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Zhimin Qian was convicted of bitcoin fraud charges.
UK police seized over £5 billion worth of crypto from her.
The seized crypto was from wallets containing 61,000 bitcoins.
Qian orchestrated a fraud in China between 2014 and 2017.
The fraud left 128,000 people out of pocket.

clusters.title: Madagascar president dissolves government after deadly protests
clusters.neutral_headline: Madagascar president dissolves government after deadly protests

items.title: Madagascar president dissolves government after deadly protests
items.standfirst: Madagascar’s president has dissolved his government in response to youth-led protests that killed at least 22 people.
items.content: Madagascar’s president has dissolved his government in response to youth-led protests that killed at least 22 people.

items.title: Madagascar’s president dissolves government amid youth-led protests
items.standfirst: Demonstrations over water and power cuts inspired by ‘gen-Z’ protests elsewhere have left at least 22 dead, says UNMadagascar’s president, Andry Rajoelina, has dissolved the government after youth-led protests over water and power cuts in which the UN says at least 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured.Inspired by the “gen Z” protests in Kenya and Nepal, the three days of demonstrations are the largest the Indian Ocean island has seen in years, and the most serious challenge Rajoelina has faced since his re-election in 2023. Continue reading...
items.content: Demonstrations over water and power cuts inspired by ‘gen-Z’ protests elsewhere have left at least 22 dead, says UNMadagascar’s president, Andry Rajoelina, has dissolved the government after youth-led protests over water and power cuts in which the UN says at least 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured.Inspired by the “gen Z” protests in Kenya and Nepal, the three days of demonstrations are the largest the Indian Ocean island has seen in years, and the most serious challenge Rajoelina has faced since his re-election in 2023. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Madagascar's president dissolved the government.
The move was in response to youth-led protests.
At least 22 people were killed in the protests.
The UN says over 100 people were injured.
The protests were inspired by "gen Z" protests elsewhere.

clusters.title: AfD politician’s former aide convicted of spying for China
clusters.neutral_headline: AfD politician’s former aide convicted of spying for China

items.title: AfD politician’s former aide convicted of spying for China
items.standfirst: Jian Guo jailed for five years after acting as agent for Chinese intelligence while working for Maximilian KrahA former aide to a member of parliament for the far-right Alternative für Deutschland party has been sentenced to almost five years in prison for spying on behalf of China.Jian Guo was convicted on Tuesday of acting as an agent for the Chinese intelligence service while working for Maximilian Krah, a former member of the European parliament who now sits for the AfD in Germany’s Bundestag. Continue reading...
items.content: Jian Guo jailed for five years after acting as agent for Chinese intelligence while working for Maximilian KrahA former aide to a member of parliament for the far-right Alternative für Deutschland party has been sentenced to almost five years in prison for spying on behalf of China.Jian Guo was convicted on Tuesday of acting as an agent for the Chinese intelligence service while working for Maximilian Krah, a former member of the European parliament who now sits for the AfD in Germany’s Bundestag. Continue reading...

items.title: Former aide to far-right German politician jailed for spying for China
items.standfirst: Jian Guo had worked in Brussels for five years for Maximilian Krah, while he was a member of the European Parliament.
items.content: Jian Guo had worked in Brussels for five years for Maximilian Krah, while he was a member of the European Parliament.

ai_summary: Jian Guo was convicted of spying for China.
He was an aide to a far-right German politician.
He worked for Maximilian Krah in Brussels.
Krah was a member of the European Parliament.
Guo was sentenced to almost five years in prison.
